byline.contributor: Alexandra Alter contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and BROOKS BARNES

abstract: Possibility that newly released Harper Lee novel Go Set a Watchman will be made into film is complicated by range of factors, not least of which is portrayal of Atticus Finch, beloved character from novel To Kill a Mockingbird, as racist; other concerns are whether Universal Pictures, which released 1962 film version of To Kill a Mockingbird, will consent to or participate in film of newer novel.
lead_paragraph: Several factors affect the possibility that “Go Set a Watchman” by Harper Lee would be made into a film.

headline.main: Complications Cloud Possibility of a Movie Based on ‘Watchman’
headline.print_headline: Film Version of ‘Watchman’? First, Untangling the Rights

snippet: Several factors affect the possibility that “Go Set a Watchman” by Harper Lee would be made into a film.
